translated: The second chapter on the causes and conditions of karmic retribution is like what is said in the Upāsaka Precepts Sūtra.
The Buddha said:
Good man!
Sentient beings create karma.
There are four kinds.

original: 一者現報今身作極善惡業即身受之是名現報二者生報今身造業次後身受是名生報三者後報今身造業次後未受更第二第三生已去受者是名後報四者無報猶無他等業是此無報業。
analyzed: 一者現報今身作極善惡業即身受之是名現報二者生報今身造業次後身受是名生報三者後報今身造業次後未受更第二第三生已去受者是名後報四者無報猶無他等業是此無報業。
translated: The first is retribution in the present life. If one creates extremely good or evil karma in this body, one will experience it in this body. This is called retribution in the present life. The second is retribution in the next life. If one creates karma in this body and experiences it in the next life, this is called retribution in the next life. The third is retribution in a later life. If one creates karma in this body and experiences it in the second or third life after the next, this is called retribution in a later life. The fourth is no retribution. It is like karma without other conditions. This is karma without retribution.
There are also four kinds.

translated: The first is when the time is definite but the retribution is indefinite. This means that the time is definite and cannot be changed, but the retribution can be changed due to the karma. The second is when the retribution is definite but the time is indefinite. This means that the power of the karma is definite and the retribution cannot be changed, but the time can be changed. The third is when both the time and the retribution are definite. This means that the karma is definite and therefore the time of retribution is also definite. The fourth is when both the time and the retribution are indefinite. This means that the karma is indeterminate and therefore the time and retribution are also indefinite. Sentient beings perform karma with completeness or incompleteness.
If one first thinks and then acts, it is called complete action.
If one directly acts without first thinking,
it is called incomplete action.
There are also those whose actions are incomplete.
This means that the karma is definite,
but the retribution is indefinite.
There are also those whose actions are complete.

There are also those who have done but not fully completed.
Upholding precepts and right views.
There are also those who have done and also fully completed.
Violating precepts and having wrong views.
There are also those who have done but not fully completed.
Regretting it at the three times.
There are also those who have done and also fully completed.
Not regretting it at the three times.
As with evil,
so it is with goodness.

then enters the womb.
